story:
Our Story

Hi!  My name is Indah Boyle and I like to dance.  I currently live in Norwalk, CT but grew up attending American Schools in foreign countries.  In high school I went to Taipei American School (TAS) in Taiwan where my love for dance was nourished and I was encouraged to believe in myself and my dreams.  Upon graduating from TAS, I attended the Conservatory of Dance at SUNY Purchase College in New York and received a B.F.A. in Dance in 2008.  I have performed my choreography at numerous venues in New York City and have taught Ballet and Modern dance in Connecticut and New York.  This past year, I was invited back to my high school in Taipei, Taiwan as a long-term dance substitute where I had the honor of teaching dance courses that I had taken as a student.  I also worked after school teaching my choreography to two groups of dancers selected by audition.  The dancers learned choreography that premiered in New York City and they performed the work at TAS after two months of intense rehearsals.

In February 2011, I chose six dancers from TAS, ages 14-16, to apply and perform my choreography for Backhausdance Platform Performance in Irvine, CA.  Platform is a weekend performance and workshop geared toward pre-professional dancers and emerging choreographers.  Selected participants will perform in three shows at Irvine Valley College and partake in two days of dance workshops.   My piece has been selected to be performed at the Platform performance June 3, 4, and 5.  The students I have asked to perform all live in Taiwan and will be traveling to CA to meet me for the event.  They will perform my piece and participate in workshops all weekend.  All participants are responsible for their own funding. Please visit www.backhausdance.org for more info on Platform and Backhausdance.


The Impact

Participating in Platform will be a unique opportunity for these students to have exposure to the dance world outside of Taiwan.  The workshops and performances will broaden their experience as dancers and as people.  With mixed nationalities coming from Taiwan, Canada, Venezuela, Japan, and the US, their backgrounds offer diversity to the event.  The students will be funding their own transportation, housing, and meals for the duration of the event.  These students will travel together and meet me in CA.  I will be supervising, transporting, feeding, and rehearsing to prepare them for the performances.


What We Need & What You Get

What I am asking from you is to help me pay for my own plane ticket, a rental car, and hotel rooms.  The parents of these students have been unbelievably supportive by funding their own child's plane ticket.  The hard work of creating a dance, performing it several times, re-setting it on high schoolers, and applying for this event is all done and paid for.  All I need now is funding to help me cover the expenses of the trip.  Your contribution of any amount will help make many people very happy.  You will be doing a huge service.  The world needs more dancing.  Any money made beyond the $1500 goal will be used for rehearsal expenses in CA and rehearsals for my upcoming projects.  Check updates and gallery for rehearsal footage of my new work.


Other Ways You Can Help

Smile a lot and be happy.

Also, share this with your friends and family.

Thank you!

story:
Our Story

If you're reading this, Hi Uncle Phil!  Remember me?  That kid at the your daughter's wedding who was reading The Good Woman of Szechuan (it's pronounced Brecked) and kept on talking about how The Book of Mormon was changing the face of the Broadway Musical?  Remember?  You mentioned how tall I was and I mentioned this theatre company I was involved in?  Then you asked me where the bathroom was and I told you I started it with alumni from the College of William and Mary (GO TRIBE!) in order to make use of our theatre degrees for something else besides waiting tables and singing showtunes on the subway.  You said something about a father-daughter dance starting, but then I had to tell you about our very first production of one-acts in May of this year, that was super well-attended (just like this wedding).  You seemed to leave in a hurry, but I KNOW you wanted to hear more.  So here's why you should return that toaster (it was regifted anyway), and use that money to support BLOWOUT THEATRE COMPANY!


This Is How We Dooo It (this is how we do it)

Half a dozen plays, twenty actors, two successful nights of theatre.  But that's in the past.  Now we are topping ourselves with a night of world premiere one-acts in October and a production of Peter Sinn Nachtrieb's boom in December, our first full length ever (EVER!).  We're working with a super-talented cast and crew on both productions and want to give them everything they need for an amazing show.

Why You Should Return that Toaster and Send Money to Us

To bring you the most awesome of awesome productions we need: a space, props, sets, costumes, lights, rights, scripts, programs, flyers, spike tape, musical instruments and probably some small thing we'll discover along the way.  With these tools, we'll be able to give our pool of playwrights, directors, designers, actors, and artists the support to bring their creations to life.


It's Not All About the Benjamins

Come see us!  Our night of one-acts, Play Date, is scheduled for October 20, 21, and 22 at 7:30 pm.  We will be at the Producer's Club, located at 358 West 44th Street (that's in New York City, Uncle Phil - you can put it in your GPS).  We'll also have a fundraiser for Play Date at the Village Pourhouse (the 46th St location) on October 14 at 7pm, so we can set our season off right.


Thanks for your support!!!

Peter, Katelin, Matt, Kerry, and Brittney

story:
ABOUT ARTESAN
Artesan Dance Company is a young emerging company known for fusing their diverse styles of ballet, modern, ethnic and break dance.  Since their inception they have been creating cohesive and exciting choreography filled with marveling athleticism and thought-provoking movement. Their performances leave audiences feeling mesmerized, inspired, and hungry for more!  The Company's debut production of "Fusion" in 2009 at the Cascade Theatre in Redding, California became an instant success and served as the catalyst for their performance a year later at the Casino de Paris in Paris, France. 

GOALS FOR THIS FALL/WINTER
In the Fall of 2011 dancers returned to Redding, California to work with Artistic Director, Summer Odell. Their time is dedicated to their continued relentless effort of creating innovative and awe-inspiring performances that challenge the limitations and mindsets of the world in which we live and awakens the heart and mind of audiences with a new passion and love for life.

 

Audience Feedback
"I loved the show tonight (Bravura) and I especially love Summer Odell's Choreography. Wild and exciting! Can't wait for the next performance. That is the same way I felt last year after watching Fusion. More. That's all I can say. More." - Michelle Sparks


"We agree. More, more, more. Summer has incredible talent. We encourage everyone to support her efforts to bring a fresh take on the performing arts to our region. Bravo!!!" - Adam Mankoski, ANewsCafe.com


"I saw you yesterday in Paris. It was very beautiful: the choreography, the costumes, the music, the dancers! Very creative! And coming all the way to Paris for a good cause, congratulations to all of you! Keep it up!" - Melanie Molitor


"I would just like to let you guys know how empowering and beautiful your dances were. You came to our school today and it was absolutely amazing! I loved every single part of it, I especially loved the way you guys mixed your dances and how well they flowed together. It was quite a masterpiece and you guys inspired me to want to try to be more outgoing in my dances and not care so much about what others think. I would like to thank you for inspiring me and for showing us your amazing dances." - Chili, High School Student


"Inspired creativity that keeps you thinking about the performance weeks later. Cannot wait to see them again!" - Dailey Alignment


"I Loved Fusion by Artesan Dance Company so much last night that I'm going again tonight and I'm bringing Ken (my husband)! I was coming out of my skin so many times during the performance. Seriously. AMAZING. Bravo, everyone. I understood the "nothing is impossible" message to an even greater extent after watching Fusion. Thank you, Summer, for challenging all of us in the realms of relationship, identity, creativity, passion, and strength. W.O.W." - Tiffany Hoyer Williams, Theatre Director of BCS


"Amazing show! Love the new scene ï¿½breaking into new worlds.ï¿½ The slow motion was jaw-dropping. Amazing dancers! Can't wait for the next show!" - Michele DeMers Anderson


"I'm on the dance team at West Valley, and the workshop was really fun, helped me learn a bunch and really, truly inspired me. You guys are incredible, and inspire me to dance even more. Can't wait to see you at the Cascade!" - Lori, High School Student


"Run, don't walk to get your tickets!!!!! It was off the charts! Absolutely RIVETING! OMG! The slow part took my breath away, I was screaming in my seat because my Spirit was sooooooo active! Go see it! LOOOOOOVED IT! :-D Another masterpiece by Summer Odell and Artesan Dance Company!!!" - Erika Gismegian


"I'm hungry for the next performance!" - Charla Sams Edwards


"Whenever Artesan Dance Company performs, it literally is an EXPERIENCE, not a performance. I've laughed and cried during their shows. This is because of the individuals who dance - they live, breath, and move DANCE." - Crystal Dueck


"Artesan Dance Company is simply AMAZING, I remember the first time I saw them perform, it was a great experience, not only are they talented but they are inspiring and very unique. I mean classical ballet and breakdancing? Definitely the best!" - Jon Nava

story:
Our Story

Magnet Theatre believes that we all have a responsibility to develop a more just, free and peaceful South African society. Transformation can never be only about developing skill. Fundamentally it involves developing  creativity, the ability to imagine alternative realities and dream different futures.

For 13 years The Magnet Theatre Educational  Trust has invested in young people in the Western Cape province of South Africa through sustained, longterm interventions that develop creativity, imagination, skills and a commitment to ongoing education.

We are seeking partners who want to invest with us.  Who share our passion to change the lives of young people in our country by offering them alternative futures through the creative and imaginative potential of the arts.

 

The Magnet Culture Gangs is a support programme for existent drama groups in Khayelitsha, one of the most violent townships outside of Cape Town, providing skills that will enable young people to function more efficiently in their communities. Magnet Theatre sends a trained facilitator into the community to work with 8 drama groups accessing approximately 250 youth.This facilitator helps the groups:

  • Sustain themselves by developing existing plays and creating new plays that they can use to generate income,
  • Grow by running monthly skills workshops where the gorups interact with each other,
  • Organise theatre visits exposing the youth to different styles and types of theatrical events,
  • Develop by running a two day December Festival in Khayelitsha of the work that all the groups have created in the year.
  • With career guidance and assistance with identifying and applying  for further education opportunities.

The Impact

Unemployment amongst youth in South Africa is currently 48-51%.  This can easily become the breeding ground for many social ills:  gangsterism, substance abuse and violent crime amongst others.

There are hundreds of school-going and unemployed youth in the townships who are drawn to the theatre as a way of expressing and dealing with the harsh realities of their lives and of generating income through performance. 

The Magnet Culture Gangs Project:

  • Exposes these young people to notions of creative thinking and play that will serve them in all aspects of their lives. 
  • Develops and supports performance as income generation 
  • Offers them skills workshops that will have an impact on the theatre that they make in their communities
  • Provides experiences that will help give a voice to their own stories and those of the people around them
  • Affirms the value and importance of those stories. 
  • Provides skills preparation and support for those who want to further their studies at University, creating a practical bridge to tertiary institutions of education.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Donations will enable Magnet Theatre to sustain the Culture Gangs for a 6 month period.  The fieldworker, Noluvuyo Sam is a talented young woman who comes from Khayelitsha.  She first made contact with Magnet Theatre in 2002 as a 13 year old performing with the Masibambisane Youth Organisation.  Through this contact she developed as an actress to the point of graduating with distinction from the University of Cape Town majoring in Community Theatre in 2010.  She is  now ready to start working in the community on a different level, ploughing back her knowledge.

Your support will help to pay the fieldworker, send 250 young people regularly  to the theatre in established and other venues in Cape Town, pay for their transport and rent rehearsal and performance spaces for their plays.


Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD.  Send this info to your friends and family, to anyone you think will love the idea of helping young people in Cape Town, South Africa.  Send it send it send it, now....

story:
About Us

Another Production Company is dedicated to presenting live performances that incorporate traditional storytelling, audience participation and ensemble based works. Which is why we have selected the Off-Broadway hit musical, The Last Five Years to start our journey. 

Jason Robert Brown's The Last Five Years musical explores the highs and lows of a five year relationship between Jamie Wellerstein, a rising novelist and Catherine Hiatt, a struggling actress. Cathy’s story is told in reverse chronological order, from the end of the relationship to the first kiss and Jamie’s story is told in chronological order. 

The Last Five Years debut in 2001 at North Shore Center for the Performing Arts in Skokie, IL before heading to New York, where it had a successful run.  

We're presenting the revival of this maginificent piece at Stage 773's initimate 69 seat Cabaret Space. 

We Need Your Support and In Return...

We have set a goal of $3,500 to cover production costs such Performance Space Rental, Rehearsal Space fees, Royalties and Performance License, Actors, Musicians, Stage Manager, Lighting Designer and most importantly the Music Director.  Moreover, we need $2,000 to get this production underway.  

We have very little time to raise these funds.  So, please help us bring this production to life TODAY!!! Simply, check out the list of REWARDS AND BENEFITS you'll receive for your generosity and make a contribution!

In advance, thank you so much for your support and we're looking forward to seeing you in the audience! 

Show Details

Opening night is Thursday, September 6 at 8:00pm.  Regular run is Sept 6 – Oct 5 on Thursdays and Fridays at 8pm.  There is no intermission.   

Valet parking is available at a rate of $10. Self parking is available after 7pm at 1248 W. Belmont (the lot for The Great American Bagel and Chase Bank).  Metered Street parking is available on Belmont as well as a metered parking lot located on Belmont and Greenview. Enter on Greenview, south of Belmont. 

Ticket prices are $25.  Purchase tickets through Stage 773 Box Office at 773-327-5252 or online: www.stage773.com.  Discount coupons and special activities will be announced through Another Production Co.’s production blog.

Visit www.anothurproductionco.com for more company and show information.

story:
The CENTER For Performing Arts at Rhinebeck is an award-winning community theater  and arts in education institution located in Rhinebeck, New York.
We operate year-round and present amazing theater productions, music, dance and children's shows. We also offer theater workshops and daytime field trips to area school children, senior citizens and rehabilitation facilities.
 
Field trip programs have been drastically reduced, and in some cases, eliminated from area schools due to budget cuts...mostly due to transportation costs. Many schools simply cannot afford the rising expenses involved to bring children to offsite events.
 
In order to continue offering students quality arts in education programming, The CENTER has created an alternative that will allow Arts in Education programs to thrive. We have started a touring company that will bring quality productions directly to schools, senior centers and community events at nominal expense.
 
We have chosen two productions, "Rip Van Winkle" based on the tale by New York author Washingon Irving, and "The Tell Tale Heart" based on classic works by Edgar Allan Poe. Our Artistic and Managing Director, Lou Trapani, wrote each script in order to keep production costs affordable.

There are other fixed costs that need to be met, such as technical equipment, costumes and sets. We are asking for your help to purchase technical equipment that is crucial for the program.

What We Need

Our equipment budget is $2,000 and includes:
  • Speakers
  • Audio Mixer
  • Laptop computer
  • Cueing Software
  • Speakers and stands
  • Cabling, racks, headphones
  • Road case

What You Get

We are so appreciative of any support of our mission to bring amazing theatrical experiences to young people. To show our gratitude, we are offering the following incentives:

  • Donate $25-$49 and receive 1 ticket to our Saturday Morning Family Series
  • Donate $50-$99 and receive 1 ticket to our Saturday Morning Family Series and a kids CENTER tee shirt
  • Donate $100 or more and receive a 4-pack of tickets to our Saturday Morning Family Series and a kids CENTER tee shirt

The Impact

Our goal has always been to bring qualty programming to everyone, regardless of income. Your support allows us to bring enriching programs to children who would otherwise not be given an opportunity to experience live theater.

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that the economy is challenging and you may not be able to support us with a monetary donation. You can help by spreading the word - send an email, post a Facebook link, send a Tweet, make a phone call. Spread the word however you can - we appreciate it!
story_txt:
The CENTER For Performing Arts at Rhinebeck is an award-winning community theater  and arts in education institution located in Rhinebeck, New York.
We operate year-round and present amazing theater productions, music, dance and children's shows. We also offer theater workshops and daytime field trips to area school children, senior citizens and rehabilitation facilities.
 
Field trip programs have been drastically reduced, and in some cases, eliminated from area schools due to budget cuts...mostly due to transportation costs. Many schools simply cannot afford the rising expenses involved to bring children to offsite events.
 
In order to continue offering students quality arts in education programming, The CENTER has created an alternative that will allow Arts in Education programs to thrive. We have started a touring company that will bring quality productions directly to schools, senior centers and community events at nominal expense.
 
We have chosen two productions, "Rip Van Winkle" based on the tale by New York author Washingon Irving, and "The Tell Tale Heart" based on classic works by Edgar Allan Poe. Our Artistic and Managing Director, Lou Trapani, wrote each script in order to keep production costs affordable.There are other fixed costs that need to be met, such as technical equipment, costumes and sets. We are asking for your help to purchase technical equipment that is crucial for the program.


What We Need
Our equipment budget is $2,000 and includes:


Speakers
Audio Mixer
Laptop computer
Cueing Software
Speakers and stands
Cabling, racks, headphones
Road case



What You Get
We are so appreciative of any support of our mission to bring amazing theatrical experiences to young people. To show our gratitude, we are offering the following incentives:

Donate $25-$49 and receive 1 ticket to our Saturday Morning Family Series
Donate $50-$99 and receive 1 ticket to our Saturday Morning Family Series and a kids CENTER tee shirt
Donate $100 or more and receive a 4-pack of tickets to our Saturday Morning Family Series and a kids CENTER tee shirt

The Impact
Our goal has always been to bring qualty programming to everyone, regardless of income. Your support allows us to bring enriching programs to children who would otherwise not be given an opportunity to experience live theater.

Other Ways You Can Help
We realize that the economy is challenging and you may not be able to support us with a monetary donation. You can help by spreading the word - send an email, post a Facebook link, send a Tweet, make a phone call. Spread the word however you can - we appreciate it!

story:
I've been invited to perform at the 2014 Asian Burlesque Spectacular in New York City.

I've been performing burlesque in Canada for 7 years. I could not have imagined that I would ever go this far in my burlesque career to be invited to such an amazing event with so many amazing performers, many of whom I've looked up to for years.

Attending and performing in this festival could be a dream come true, but I can't do it alone. As my burlesque career has always been shaped by my supporters and friends, I look to you to help me fulfill this dream.

I will need a total of $2500 CAD to help me get to New York. Although my expenses will be approximately $2500, just for flights and accommodation, any and all donations will be appreciated and used to fund this trip. If my goal of $2500 is exceeded, any remaining donations will go towards a local charity that we will vote on together!

  • Flights: Approximately $1000 CAD, return flight
  • Hotel Accommodation: Approxiamtely $180/night for 7 nights, $1260 CAD

story:
Hello Bassheads!

Hi! I'm DJRap ....its a long story how I got my name but I was the first DJ to play hip hop samples underneath house music BEFORE DRUM AND BASS was even invented! I have 2 record labels,PROPA TALENT & IMPROPA TALENT and have sold over 3 million records.I am mainly know for my my jungle classics 'Spiritual Aura, Digable Bass, Roughest Gunark' and Learning Curve- to name just a few-you can check out all about me on www.djrap.com if you like! It has been a dream of mine to start a wicked D&B night here in Los Angeles so I launched 'PROPA' last November. It was a great success so we did it again in DEC.Take a look at some of the pics! We are now looking to expand our monthly to a friday night due to the initial response being so positive by including international talent on a monthly basis as well as continuing to shine a light on local talent at Room 86/Dim Mak Studios.So yes,we will be campaigning hard every month to bring you the best party in Los Angeles!This is simply to cover costs which I have broken down for you in the next section. So what is the end result? We get an international DJ that you know and love- and the night is going to be awesome!!!

  • HOW YOU CAN HELP!

    Your contribution will fund the following:


    • Our goal is to simply fund this D&B monthly.Date in Feb to be announced shortly.
    • Funds raised will determine if we book international or domestic talent.
    • we welcome your feedback to those who contribute-you will receive a survey asking who you would like us to bring to perform based on their availability of course! regarding who you want to see play,together we can make this happen!
  • 100% of all proceeds raised by this campaign will be applied to February's event.

Here is the breakdown of Expenses.

  • International talent approx. cost: $1500-$5000 Domestic starts at $500-$2500
    • (Funds raised will determine if we book international or domestic talent based on availablity)
  • International flights approx. $1000 Domestic approx. $500
  • Hotel cost approx. $150-$200
  • Production/Lights/sound  approx. $200-500
  • Flyer design  approx. $100
  • Door approx. $50
  • Promotion approx. $50
  • MC approx. $50-$100

Hopefully,this gives you a clear understanding of what is involved in throwing an event!

  • Help me to give YOU the party you want! 
Other Ways You Can Help

We all have to pay bills,if a contribution isn't on the cards we would love if you could share this campaign with everyone via your social networks,your friends,and with  Indiegogo share tools

We also would love your creative input! We will be communicating with you all the way-so know your input is vastly appreciated!

  • Lets Do It 'PROPA!'

story:
About Our Company and Anti-Bullying Campaign

  • Laughing Giraffe Productions, founded in 2012, is a NYC-based theatrical producing organization.  This fall Laughing Giraffe will launch its first Anti-Bullying Children's Theater Tour- WANDA'S WORLD!   
  • Wanda's World  is a musical with a pop-rock score and lyrics by Beth Falcone, and a book by Eric H. Weinberger.  We could not think of a more appropriate show to tour as an anti-bullying campaign.  This award-winning musical is about acceptance and embracing what makes us unique.  
  • We will be touring throughout the Northeast this October, spreading Wanda's message for Anti-Bullying Month, playing everywhere from professional theatrical venues to school auditoriums.                                                                                                            

Fundraising Goals

  • The remaining cost of producing this tour is 22k.  We are looking to raise at least $14,000 via indiegogo. 
  • These funds support the many expenses of this project: travel expenses (van rental and gasoline), hotel rooms, sets, costumes, props, sound and light equipment, rights for the shows, and more!

Facts About Bullying

These facts derive from studies by the National Education Association:

  • Bullying is the most common form of violence in our society.
  • It is estimated that 160,000 children miss school every day due to fear of attack or intimidation by other students.  That means approximately 15% of all school absenteeism is directly related to fears of being bullied at school.
  • 90% of 3rd through 8th graders report being victims of bullying.
  • 1 out of every 10 students who drops out of school does so because of repeated bullying.

Other Ways You Can Help

Our remaining fundraising goal is 22k, but we are looking to raise at least 14k via indiegogo!  No amount is too small.  If you can't contribute today, help us spread the word! Share this link on your Facebook, Twitter or via email!

Cast and Creative Team

PRODUCING TEAM:                                                                                                                       Colton Pometta  (Founder, Executive Producer)                                                                   Cara Recinella     (Associate Producer)                                                                                     Amanda Wilson   (Associate Producer)  

Direction and Choreography: Colton Pometta    

Music Direction: Anthime Miller                                                                

Cast:  Yadin Goldman, Jara Green, Katie Hayes, Max Kantor, John Kish, Maggie Randolph, Cara Recinella, Kyle Sallee, Aubrey Taylor and Amanda Wilson    

Stage and Tour Management: Imani Denson-Pittman

story:
Hey all,
I'm a senior this year at Cornish College of the Arts. I'm getting my Bachelors in Fine Arts in Dance in May 2013, which is soon. Then I'll be looking for my place in the dance world. In order to have better chances of accomplishing my goal of landing a job with a well-established Dance company (like Mark Morris or Paul Taylor) I need to get noticed with Directors and Choreographers.
American Dance Festival offers a great opportunity for dancers to see many different Choreographers. A.D.F. offers nine days of classes, panels, performances, and more. They have a well known group of outstanding teachers who demonstrate supportive learning environments with individual attention. I'll get to learn about the "New York" dance scene from artists who are currently creating work. Plus ill get to see open rehearsals and performances at Alvin Alley or The Joyce Theater for an "insiders" perspective. And all while living the New York DREAM and having fun!

I'll need expensives for the intensive to start. For me to sign up and reserve a spot I must make a deposit of $200. After Deposit secured my spot, I have to pay the remaining total of $550 by November 30th 2012. A total of $750 for the winter intensive. I'll also need travel (plane, and taxi) expenses to help me get there and stay there living (hotel) a nutritional dancers life. I'll be dancing Eight hours a day so it is very important for me to keep up on my nutrition during strenuous daily activity. Though, all your money WILL be refunded if I miss the deadline to registration.

If you would rather send me a check in the mail, I would deposit the money and use that as a donation from myself to my campaign so you can see the money will be there for good! I will put your name in the description.

I will be setting up a blog for donators to look at daily and see my progress with this Winter Intensives and to see how much fun I would be having daily.   

Dancers never stop learning, and this would be a great opportunity to achieve further mastery and professionalism for my future in Dance!

Thanks,
Will C.

story:
WHO WE ARE

www.thegraceperiodblog.wordpress.com

Named for the period of time between graduation and the beginning of student loan repayment, The Grace Period is a team made up of seven anonymous artists attempting to work through the difficulties of making a living as an artist in a weakened economy. In its current iteration, The Grace Period Blog, each of the seven artists has taken their own personal and artistic journey through the ups and downs of leading an artistic life in today’s world. Now, the members of The Grace Period are collaborating on a live performance which will combine our voices with yours, and with the voices of millions of other citizens facing serious student loan debt. To make this project come to life, and in the spirit of community and solidarity, we need your help!

WHAT WE NEED

We can’t do this without your support! If you’re unable to donate, we ask you to please share this link and help to get our voices and our cause out there; we also invite you to check out our blog if you haven't yet and of course, to save the date for our performance, which of course will be FREE!

We’re making our art work for us. But we can’t do it alone. Here’s a breakdown of our anticipated expenses for the project/performance:

WAGES

This is part of making our art work for us. If you feel that all (art)work is of value and should be compensated, as we do, this is where you can help make this happen! We have all put in many hours for this project, not just in planning and preparing this performance, but in researching, writing blog posts, and, eventually, in rehearsal time. It’s all been a lot of hard work, and we’re thankful for it! In keeping with our theme of art, work, and the value of art/artists in today’s society, part of our project entails earning minimum wage for the work we have done. Though it is difficult to calculate just how many hours we have worked on our own projects, we have narrowed our wages to the collaborative meetings (and rehearsals yet to  come) held by the members of The Grace Period.

Minimum wage sits at $7.25/hour and we are each committing to 35 hours of work from each member. 7.25 x 7 members x 35 hours = $1776.25

Since the time put into blog posts is less simple to calculate, we have taken a route similar to many freelancing websites or journal publications, who pay either per piece or per word. For each blog post we are asking $5.00 in payment, from September 2 to November 21 only. Each member will have posted a total of 8 blog entries. 8 posts x 7 members x 5.00 per piece = $280.00.

Total amount of wages: $2,056.25

PERFORMANCE MATERIALS

For now, we’re keeping many of the details of our performance under wraps in order to preserve an atmosphere of spontaneity and in-the-heat-of-the-moment political passion. What we can reveal is some of our materials and their cost:

Equipment/supplies for the performance:

Megaphones: $301.00

Cups: $36.00

Jello: $60.00

Zip Car/Uhaul rental: $80.00

Total amount of performance supplies/equipment: $477.00

PROMOTIONAL MATERIALS, INCLUDING PERKS FOR YOU OUR SUPPORTERS:

Printing/Mailing Budget: $500.00

Biz Cards: $60.00

Save-the-Date Postcards: $130.00

Postcards for sponsors (you!): $200.00

Total amount of promotional materials: $890.00

Total amount of performance & promotional materials: $1367.00

INDIEGOGO FEES (Not added to our goal)

If the project’s goal is reached, Indiegogo charges 4% of the total amount earned. This is equal to $115.58 of our total cost.

In addition, credit card processing fees make up a total of 3% of our earned funds. This is equal to $86.68 of our total cost.

Total amount of fees: $346.73

Total project cost: $3423.25 (before indiegogo fees).

So we are just asking for $ 3,500.00, to have a round number and cover some of the fees.

WHAT YOU GET

In addition to the warm, fuzzy feeling of helping us fulfill our financial and artistic goals, we’ve arranged some perks that you’ll receive for certain donation amounts. Here’s what you can get from us as a thank you gesture:

$1.00 We’ll give you or your organization a public thank you on our Facebook page and/or Twitter account

$5.00 In keeping with our price of $5 per blog, for a $5 donation we will invite you to be a guest blogger with us and create a post (as artistic or straightforward as you want!) for The Grace Period Blog.

$10.00 A promotional November 21st Save the Date Postcard from the members of The Grace Period

$25.00 One of 7 special edition postcards designed by one of our bloggers

$50.00 Get all 7 special edition post-cards designed by the bloggers

$100.00 One of a kind Zine by one of our bloggers.

$300.00 Your choice: join us for a rehearsal for November 21st OR get a custom-made art piece, in a range of mediums using our various talents, from one of our bloggers

We can’t do this without your support! If you’re unable to donate, we ask you to please share this link and help to get our voices and our cause out there; we also invite you to save the date for our performance which of course will be free.

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts!

The Grace Period

www.thegraceperiodblog.wordpress.com

story:
Esmeralda Enrique Spanish Dance Company

Flamenco has shaped my life’s history. It is my great passion. It excites my mind, it enraptures my soul and comforts my spirit. Through flamenco I find truth, beauty and goodness. Good flamenco is always stirring to the listener who hears with their heart. It communicates beyond what words can describe and beyond what movement can say. It is the language of the soul. Flamenco is more than a profession to me, it is a way of life, and it permeates my personal and professional life through its philosophy of honesty, dignity and integrity.

Flamenco, an art form like no other, speaks to the heart and touches the soul. The award winning Esmeralda Spanish Dance Company of Canadian and Spanish dancers, singers and musicians deliver the power of this expressive art with elegance and passion. The company never fails to enthrall audiences, eliciting shouts of olé and standing ovations.

Your contribution to the Esmeralda Enrique Spanish Dance Company will go towards the creation and production of De Idas y Vueltas that will be presented at the Fleck Dance Theatre in Toronto, Canada, April 24-26 at 8:00 PM and April 27 at 3:00 PM as part of Harbourfront Centre’s NextSteps Dance Series. We count on the generosity of people who also love flamenco to make this world premiere possible.

De Idas y Vueltas celebrates the Latin American songs that have been integrated into flamenco and uses these transmigrations to explore how things come and go in our lives, sometimes they return forever altered, other times they never return at all.  I invite you to come on this journey with us.
                                                                                                                  
- Esmeralda Enrique

All funds raised will go directly to the production of De Idas y Vueltas.


WHO IS INVOLVED:

Esmeralda Enrique: dancer, choreographer, Artistic Director

Toronto Dancers:
Pamela Briz, Paloma Cortés, Ilse Gudiño, Noelia La Morocha

Spanish Artists:
Javier Latorre - choreographer
“El Junco” - Male dancer/choreographer
Óscar Lago - Guitarist & Music Director 
Manuel Soto - Singer
Matías López - Singer

Toronto Artists:
Benjamin Barrile - Guitarist
Rosendo “Chendy” León - Percussionist
Chris Church - Violinist
Sharon DiGenova - Lighting Designer/Technical Director

Other Artists: 

Costume Designer, Video Projection Designer, Videographer, Photographer, Graphic Designer,
Prop Maker

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

Your contribution will go towards the following production costs:

Artist Fees, Travel, Accommodation and per diems:
3 choreographers, 6 dancers, 2 guitarists, 2 singers, 1 violinist, 1 percussionist

This year we are thrilled to bring the world-renowned dancer “El Junco” for the second time, the brilliant guitarist and composer Óscar Lago joins the company for the fourth time, the fabulous singer Manuel Soto returns for his fourth season and debuting with the company is singer Matías López. These four artists will travel to Toronto from Seville and for 12 days of rehearsals and 4 days of performances.

Costumes: Each costume is individually fitted to the dancer and the way they move. They are meticulously handcrafted locally in Toronto. 

Production and Promotion: These expenses include lighting design, theatre rental, studio rental, sound equipment, theatre crew, front of house staff, box office, marketing, advertising and publicity and the key person who puts it all together: our Technical Director, Sharon DiGenova. 

In order to make a contribution, please choose from one of the perks listed to the right.  If you are a resident of Canada you will receive a charitable receipt for the maximum allowable amount (as per CRA regulations).

Please note that it is also possible to make an anonymous contribution at any level.

See photos of past performances   |   Watch more videos   |   Listen

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

·  Share this campaign on your websites and social media sites to help spread the word. 

·  'Like' our official Facebook page: click here

·  Use the Indiegogo share tools listed below

·  Contact us to volunteer your time, expertise, etc.

From the bottom of my heart…GRACIAS A TODOS!
- Esmeralda Enrique 

www.flamencos.net

Esmeralda Enrique Spanish
Dance Company
Flamenco has shaped my life’s history. It is
my great passion. It excites my mind, it enraptures my soul and comforts my
spirit. Through flamenco I find truth, beauty and goodness. Good flamenco is
always stirring to the listener who hears with their heart. It communicates
beyond what words can describe and beyond what movement can say. It is the
language of the soul. Flamenco is more than a profession to me, it is a way of
life, and it permeates my personal and professional life through its philosophy
of honesty, dignity and integrity. Flamenco, an art form like no other, speaks to the
heart and touches the soul. The award winning Esmeralda Spanish Dance Company of
Canadian and Spanish dancers, singers and musicians deliver the power of this
expressive art with elegance and passion. The company never fails to enthrall
audiences, eliciting shouts of olé
and standing ovations.

story:
Boy do I need help and fast.

_________________________________________________________

Here is the Back Story

I am a stage manager/ designer in my local city of Ottawa Ontario Canada. I have applied to CO-SI (Centre for Opera Studies in Italy) for their Intern Stage Management Program. You get to stay in Italy for a month, learn how to stage manage opera, and you get an equity credit too. I have been trying for years to get an equity credit and I saw the notice in my email about the CO-SI program. Since at the time it was a bit of an impulse, I signed up not thinking I would get in with my lack of music knowledge.

Then a couple of days ago I get a notice saying I was accepted. I had to read the letter a few times to see if I read "you've been accepted" correctly , or it was actually said "you've been ACCEPTED to not join our program..." But no, it said I was accepted. Yeay!

 When I finally came out of my happy trance, I found I had to get half of the money in by March 30th, then the other half by April 30th.

So I thought that was a bit stressful in such a short time, but that wasn't the end of it I found out today that the amount I need to get is just for the tuition. I also have to raise money for airfare, travel insurance, and make a deposit to my flight by MARCH 13TH. So I am freaking out a little because I have about $50 in the bank and it's not looking good for me.

The sad truth is with my 4-5 jobs at minimum wage there is no way to get at least half of the amount by the end of the month and this is one of those situations where I can't do this on my own.

_____________________________________________________________

Back to Present Day

Some of my friends suggested trying Indiegogo and see what comes out of it. I know it helped my boyfriend (Zach Counsil) for his audition in New York, so hopefully it helps me ,the little match stick girl, with my predicament.


I don't expect to raise the whole $7000 with Indiegogo, but ANY amount I make with this campaign would be a step in the right direction for sure. You can donate ANY amount you like, 1$, 5$.... $7000 I will  be tremendously happy with your generosity. I know the theatre community is always happy to lend a hand to support there fellow artists and I am confident that I will kick butt in this program. Then when I have finished my program with flying colours, thanks to everyone who donated, Ottawa Ontario (and the world) will have another bad ass mo-fo stage manager on their team. So it is pretty much a win win situation.

Thank you so much for coming to my indiegogo website. If you like more info on the CO-SI program, click here. If you are poor like me, can't afford to donate, but want to help, please spread the word to anyone and everyone you know so I can get a chance to make my wish come true by becoming a stage managing pro.

Wish me Luck!


To entice you even further, here is a cat video to get some extra sympathy votes. :D

Love Ya!



What I need to Raise.
_________________________



By March 29th I will need to raise $2175 for half of the tuition fees.


By April 30th I will need another $2175 for the other half of the tution fees.


$1400 for the rest of the Airfare, travel and medical insurance, 


Ingiegogo takes a chunck which would be roughly around $500 if I reach my goal.


So I need to raise at least $5750.

story:
Who We are and What We’re Up To

The Women’s Bellydance Center (WBC) has been in Tallahassee, FL since 2006, but this year we’re dreaming big. Julie Wilson, the center’s director, built it from the ground up. She has danced her way through breast cancer, fibromyalgia, and being a single mom. She’s served as an inspiration for me and many of the other women and girls that have studied under her. I’m Patrice DeVore, and this year, along with the entire troupe, we are mobilizing to boost the name recognition of the Women’s Bellydance Center and get enough money to revitalize the tradition of an annual show.

This is phase one of our journey, we want to boost our name recognition by getting a booth at the “What Women Want” expo. This is an event in Tallahassee held every year by the local Cumulus radio stations. It’s the perfect opportunity for us, the attendance at this event increases every year and this year we’re not going to miss out. Your contributions will help us pay for the booth, radio spots with Cumulus, and promotional items to give away at the booth.

So Here’s the Deal

We are asking for $700, the basics of what we need to make this happen. We need $250 (we have already scraped together the deposit of $250) for the What Women Want booth itself, $300 to spend on local radio ads, and $200 to spend on promotional items to give away at our booth.

In return, you, the generous donor, gets to choose from a number of amazing perks. You can get perks ranging from beautiful hip scarves, to free classes for a month at the center! This definitely worth getting in on!

The real deal is that no matter what you give, we’ll think you’re awesome. Even if you can’t monetarily, but you still let people know about us and like our facebook page, we’ll still think you’re awesome. Trust me, we know about being broke. Check out our website or tell your friend who’s looking for something different to try. Then sit back and appreciate the warm fuzzies flowing in your direction.

The Impact

We’re the girls who like glitter and sparkles, but still want to seem cultured and sophisticated. We like swinging swords and playing with fire. We’re a complicated bunch, but we think we’re cool. The impact of this campaign is enabling us to show how cool we are. That’s the overall goal. We also kind of want to keep a roof over our studio too, but why don’t we just lump that in with the cool part and call it good?

This phase of our mission will hopefully get the people in the door to take classes, and get our name out to be hired for gigs. That’s the point, short and sweet.

story:
What is WANDERLUST?

WANDERLUST is a strip show and circus with an all-queer cast from across the nation. It is performance art for queers, by queers.

What if the prospect of the TSA patdown was not anxiety-producing and terrifying for trans* travelers, but rather tantalizing?? What if rest stop bathrooms weren’t full of suspicious everyday-gender-police, but doily-flagging queers into hot, consensual (and of course, safer) public sex? How might bicycling queers combat and preempt road rage using their U-lock in a fantasy scenario?

WANDERLUST aims to answer these questions and more, while entertaining the
audience and turning them on. With a cast of professional aerialists, pole dancers, striptease artists and dancers this live theater show (with video interludes by esteemed filmmakers) is guaranteed to be a hit. It is currently in pre-production, and slated to debut in June 2014 in the San Francisco Bay Area. With a dual cast (East and West Coasts of North America) WANDERLUST will bring this sensuous show to a wide audience.


Why Is This Show Important??


For trans* and gender non-conforming people, and queer people of MANY intersectionalities, transit spaces (airports, buses, subways, streets, sidewalks) are often some of the most anxiety-ridden and problematic: full of overly-watchful eyes, invasive questions and procedures, and constant policing. Money hungry airlines shame and harm fat-bodied and disabled-bodied people to no end. Queers are targeted and harassed on the streets, at X-ray machines, while crossing borders, and more.

This group strip show and circus arts performance is a trans*/queer re-imagining of various travel spaces as at once size/ability/gender-affirming AND sexy. At its root, this project tells the stories of those of us who move through the world in bodies that refuse to meet other people’s expectations.


What We Need & What You Get

  • $9700. We're committed to paying our artists in a way that recognizes that a performance is just the tip of the iceberg - beneath the surface is intellectual labor, development, travel, workshop, rehearsal and more.
  • Our perks are ridiculous! They're useful AND cool. Our multi-talented artists are putting their skills to work to offer you some of the most original perks around. Custom leather luggage tags, a chance to win tickets and art, a cocktail hour with cast members, and a professional massage are just some of the great perks that come with donating!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Please chat us up and SHARE this page on Facebook and Twitter! Let people know about the work we're doing!
  • We could use: a writer (blogs and publicity), donated frequent flyer miles, publicity connections, high-volume printing connections.

Thanks for supporting WANDERLUST!

story:
LONE WOLF TRIBE is...

A multi-disciplinary theatre company sparked long ago from the simple act of my grandmother making a sock puppet for me as a boy. That gift, that notion of creating and sharing from the heart, has led my artistic path ever since.  I've put my heart and soul into Lone Wolf Tribe. Utilizing all my gifts and talents, LWT's mission is to create original theatre and share stories with a live audience, focusing on what brings us together rather than what keeps us apart.

WE ARE RAISING MONEY TO...

Help fund our first official "season"~ where we'll produce and perform 2 NY debut productions within 4 months of each other! 

The Season:

The God Projekt

November 14th - 24th, 2013 at La MaMa, Etc.

A minimal extravaganza, heaven-set murder mystery!  God, alone in a Beckett-inspired vision of paradise, does his level best to manage his divine office. But while fielding an unending flow of prayer requests, he uncovers a secret from his ancient past he'd rather remain forgotten. A daring and compassionate journey about waking up to one's own truth.

Hobo Grunt Cycle

March 14th - 29th, 2014 at Dixon Place  

Challenging war's futility with poetic imagery and a clown's mix of humor and pathos, this nearly silent circus pantomime looks towards a path to peace. Forging empathetic links between wounded soldiers and rescued fight dogs, the post-war legacy of veterans is exposed when a lowly tramp puts his heart and soul into healing his beloved pet. 

 Associate collaborators: Brooklyn for Peace, Veterans for Peace, Fort Green for Peace

THE REASON WE NEED YOUR HELP...

Lone Wolf Tribe's shows are expensive ~ more than your typical puppet show. The main reason for this is that they take a long time to create. Generally, from initial ideas to fully produced show, one production takes us between 2 to 3 years! 

A big part of that time is spent pushing the limits of our capabilities through development and experimentation. Fueled by a drive for artistic excellence, we never lose sight that all the work and long hours are towards a greater good: to share something wonderful and unforgettable with our audience.

LONE WOLF TRIBE'S IMPACT...

Our hope is that we raise the bar of the theatrical experience for both national and international audiences.  As we join the magic and beauty of puppetry with an empathetic consciousness of the world around us - through intelligent stories that aim to touch both the heart and mind - our creative desire is to play a small part in making this world a more wonderful place.

DOLLARS AND CENTS...

The specific funds we will raise will go to:

  • Artistic Fees: Puppeteers, designers (sound, lighting, costume, graphics), collaborators, technicians                                                                       
  • Rehearsal space
  • Equipment, materials & special effects
  • Marketing, promotion and postage
  • Curation and installation of an exhibition of original veteran art work to be shown in the Dixon Place gallery during the run of Hobo Grunt Cycle 

We are counting on your support that the $7,000 we raise through this campaign will be integral to the success of our productions.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP...

If you can't contribute now and would like to help out in another way, please consider making a bit of noise about our shows and this campaign. Post this link to your Facebook profile or Twitter feed! 

 

THANK YOU!!!

We look forward to seeing you at the theatre this coming year.

Sincerely,

Kevin Augustine/Lone Wolf Tribe 

LWT's season is a sponsored project of Untitled Theater Company #61, Ltd is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization. All donations are tax-deductible to the full extent permitted by law. You received no goods or services in exchange for your donation.

Rehearsal space
Equipment, materials & special effects
Marketing, promotion and postage
Curation and installation of an exhibition of original veteran art work to be shown in the Dixon Place gallery during the run of Hobo Grunt Cycle 

We are counting on your support that the $7,000 we raise through this campaign will be integral to the success of our productions.
 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP...
If you can't contribute now and would like to help out in another way, please consider making a bit of noise about our shows and this campaign. Post this link to your Facebook profile or Twitter feed! 
 
THANK YOU!!!
We look forward to seeing you at the theatre this coming year.

Sincerely,
Kevin Augustine/Lone Wolf Tribe 
LWT's season is a sponsored project of Untitled Theater Company #61, Ltd is a 501(c)3 non-profit organization. All donations are tax-deductible to the full extent permitted by law. You received no goods or services in exchange for your donation.

story:
Short Summary

Hi I am Lenny Schwartz! I am trying to raise funds to bring eleven actors from Rhode Island to NYC...one way or another we are going but I figured I would try this way and try to do a little good in the process.

We here at Daydream Theatre Company are trying to raise money for a play we are doing in NYC called "Subject 62." We are performing at the Gene Frankel Theatre.

Subject 62 is a play written and directed by Lenny Schwartz. It is a surreal drama about an artist, Chris, who is afflicted with a degenrative disease called Huntington's. When he is signed up for a unique experiment to find a cure, he finds himself trapped in his memories, losing them as he tries to hold onto a single one to take with him.

Basicaly we are taking 11 actors from RI to NYC...and that costs money. We are already on the fundraising trail but here's the thing: The money will go to housing and feeding the actors. That being said, it won't cost 3600 to do that. So we will donate whatever extra we don;t need to the charitable orginization Huntington's Disease Association of America which is the national network for people afflicted with this terrible disease. . So spread the word...and I will donate whatever we do not use.

IF WE RAISE THE FULL 3600 on here? I will PERSONALLY DONATE 250 to the  Huntington's Disease Association of America and if we don't I'll still donate 50 dollars!-Lenny

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • SPREAD THE WORD!!!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Please help send Molly Marjorie Rosenblatt Needs A Man (And Other Stuff) to the NY Internation Fringe Festival. It's a big project and a huge journey; please help make this possible.

The money goes to the festival fee, rehearsal space, publicity, marketing, playbills, purchasing and building a door frame and having it moved from a construction place to a theater, paying the necessary people involved, and everything else that comes with producing independent theater at a major NYC festival. Every cent counts, and the more that is raised, the more that can be done. Please support the arts!

For more about the show, see www.mmrneedsaman.com,  like it on facebook, and follow it on twitter @MMRNeedsAMan.l

story:
Hello all!

My name is Shawn Nabors. I'm a recent college graduate of Syracuse University, a Brooklyn, N.Y. native and an actor, playwright and poet. I'm ridiculously ecstatic about having the opportunity to produce my brand new play, CAKE, Off-Broadway this summer at the American Theatre of Actors from August 1st - 4th! I'm also very excited to be able to make you a part of this extraordinary creative process.

 CAKE is going to be produced this summer through a program called the Araca Project. The play will be opening this years 2nd annual season of shows, all shows being produced by young emerging theatre artists. 

The play takes place on March 3rd, in Brooklyn, N.Y. on the eve of the main character, Messiah's, late daughters 3rd birthday. Overwhelmed with grief and regret, Messiah is at the lowest low point of his life and has not left his room in days. He goes online and arranges a "casual encounter" with a young man named Ari and the two of them wind up invested and involved in way more than either one of them originally expected. 

Words cannot express how thrilled I am to have the chance to bring this story to life. I've been working on this play tirelessly for the past year and a half and am ready to step into the next necessary phase of development. I am in need of $7,000 of funding for Light, Sound, Set & Costume design, Transportation of equipment, Rehearsal space, etc. 

I have been dreaming about pursuing a career theatre since I was twelve years old and now, after college, I finally have the opportunity to do so. This is an experience that I cannot pass up on. My life as an artist and as a human being will forever be changed by this. I would learn not only how to further my training as an actor but also gain first hand knowledge on how to produce a show with a team of producers. The ability to create one's own opportunities is crucial in this business and I will be able to take the things I learn from this experience with me into future creative endeavors throughout the duration of my career.

This play is very edgy and raw in a lot of its content and its important to me present strong images for the sake of widening perspectives and creating dialogue amongst people. Wouldn't you love to be a part of that? : )

Perks!

What We Need & What You Get

  • If you donate $25 of support you will receive a special shout-out and thank you on our facebook page and twitter.
  • If you donate $50 of support you will receive a signed poster from this summers Off-Broadway production.
  • If you donate $75 of support you will receive a free CAKE 2012 T-shirt after the show's opening night.
  • If you donate $100 of support you will receive a free invite into one of the CAKE 2012 rehearsals.
  • If you donate $200 of support you will receive a free night of dining with the producing team.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute, there are definitely other ways that you can help!
  • Like our facebook page, facebook.com/cakeplay2012 and spread the word about our play! Stay tuned for all events, fundraisers and such that we will be posting and get other people to like it as well.
  • Definitely share our IndieGoGo page with others as well and let's get this movement going. Remember, creating great works of art takes a community and I'm so glad to be a part of this community with you. 
Thank you!

-Shawn Nabors

story:
Brava for Women in the Arts needs your support

The buzz before the curtain rises.  There is nothing like it.  Brava! For Women in the Arts invites you to catch a buzz with us as we work to revitalize a San Francisco treasure. Brava is seeking $50,000 to seed the revitalization of the organization and jumpstart the completion of the Brava Theater Center, a performance, education and community engagement space in San Francisco’s Mission District. 

OUR STORY

Founded in 1986 by an eclectic, talented group of women artists, Brava evolved from an all-volunteer organization into a nationally recognized producing and presenting organization with a devoted audience and a production history of more than 1,400 performances seen by over 350,000 people.  For over 25 years Brava has been a gathering place for community arts organizations, and nationally and internationally acclaimed artists.  Of equal importance is the role Brava has played in sustaining arts education in neighborhood schools, providing vital programming in theater training to the young people San Francisco. 

THE PROJECT

In 1996, Brava bought the York Theater – a 10,000 square foot property on 24th street between York and Hampshire that included a 70-year-old former vaudeville house and six storefronts - and began a three-stage renovation.  The first two stages converted the 900-seat movie house into an intimate 365-seat theater that included a renovated lobby and a 1,200 square foot studio/second stage multi-purpose space.  The third and final stage of the renovation, which began in 2008, was put on hold as Brava, like many organizations both locally and nationally began to feel the impact of the Great Recession.   This final stage will convert the six abandoned storefronts along 24th Street into much needed dressing rooms for the main stage, office space for Brava and other non-profit arts and community organizations and a 1,000 square foot area destined to be a multi-purpose performance/rehearsal space.

THE IMPACT

Brava Theatre Center is an anchor in the grassroots driven economic development of the 24th Street Corridor in the Mission District.  The Center provides vital artistic and cultural enrichment for the community, and serves as an important tool in arts education.  We are very happy that on March 15th Loco Bloco moved in as a resident company. They will join long time renters Cuicacalli Escuela de Danza and 915 Cayuga, a radio drama performance group as artists-in-residence at the Brava Theater Center.   Additional bookings and new residents include:  Teatro Vagon, Classical Revolution, La Bohemia Productions, Volti Chitresh Das Dance, Freshmeat Productions, Thrill Peddlers, and The 1st Annual Son Jarocho Festival.

It is these community artists, educational and community engagement organizations that will benefit from a complete and self-sustaining building.  In addition, the completed facility will have significant economic impact on the 24th Street corridor, as Brava’s audiences, students, and production staff that pass through our doors the more our neighboring restaurants, eateries, cultural institutions, corner stores, bookstores, and shops will benefit from our clientele. 

 

BRAVA!’s leadership has a strong vision of how to improve our facilities to better serve our mission by completing this renovation.  In preparing to move forward Brava recently has under gone staff restructuring.  The organization’s new Executive Director is Stacie Powers Cuellar.  In a career spanning 30 years in San Francisco’s community arts scene, Stacie has worked with a wide range of organizations as an arts and financial administrator, including the San Francisco Mime Troupe, Frameline’s International LGBT Film Festival, Dance Brigade and Dance Mission Theater.

YOU CAN MAKE A DIFFERENCE

This amazing space needs your help. We are trying to raise $50,000 in order to stabilize the organization, do some much-needed repairs, subsidize the community artists who perform here and support our educational programming.  These funds will allow us to move forward and give us the base we need to continue operating.

story:
Short Summary

Jim May is the Artistic Director of Sokolow Theatre Dance Ensemble, a company dedicated to preserve and recreate works choreographed by the late Anna Sokolow; Mr. May is determined to save important works from extinction and pass them on to the ensemble's dedicated dancers. PRELUDES (1984), Anna Sokolow's dance to the music of George Gershwin, which hasn't been seen since 1986 is Mr. May's 16th reconstruction in the last 10 years. There is only one existing video of Juilliard's students dancing PRELUDES in 1986 located at the NY Library of the Performing Arts; Mr. May obtained permission to use this rare video to help with the reconstruction.

PRELUDES will be part of the Sokolow Ensemble's annual season in December of 2014 which will feature four American artists whose influence is felt world wide:  Edgar Allen Poe, Frida Kahlo, George Gershwin, and Anna Sokolow will highlight the company's unique ability to combine the arts: poetry, painting, music, theater, and dance.

What We Need 

What you see on stage is the final product of many hours of rehearsals, schedule coordination, costumes designing, and much much more; and this is for one dance only! With your donation, you will be helping us tremendously covering these costs and you'll be forever part of our process.

  • Rehearsal Space with a piano: 4-6 hours a week for at least 2-3 months....
  • Costumes: designing/creating costumes from the 1930s for 8-10 dancers
  • Live music: pianist, scores, piano tuning....and more rehearsal!

The Impact

The costs of costumes, rehearsal space, salaries, technicians, theaters, etc. has grown while government grants has shrunk.

Your donation will support the following expenses:

  • $1200 Rent/Rehearsal Space
  • $1500 Costumes
  • $850 Pianist and Score

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • share this with your friends!
  • sign up on our email list and make sure you don't miss our events
  • come see us in December!
  • Follow us on Facebook and Twitter

story:
UPDATE!!!!!!!!!!

So...... we did it! We have commitments of another £1,300 so have made our target of £3,000! But..... there is still plenty of time to donate as any excess monies will be used to boost advertising etc.

If you are going to be in the Fringe check out this link below for listings and venue information:

http://www.broadwaybaby.com/shows/a-tranny-on-the-verge-of-a-nervous-breakdown/702735

And finally a massive thank you to all who have donated - this couldn't have happened without you! Those of you who have picked a perk will receive a separate message with details - if you have selected the VIP fringe ticket then please let me know which date you want to meet me and I will get the Champagne!! Signed posters will be delivered after my final show and don't forget to look out for your behind the scenes video towards the end of the month! Thank you so much!

Lot of love 

Mzz Kim xx

And the campaign.............................................

Who am I and why do I need you?

My name is Mzz Kimberly (call me Mzz Kim!). I’m a transgender singer and performer from the US, now living in the UK. I have a wide repertoire of music and have performed in over 50 London venues including residencies at the Royal Vauxhall Tavern, The Ivy and recent performances with one of my fans – Stephen K Amos and on Britain's Got Talent. My voice has been compared many times to Bassey and Tina Turner and in 2011 I won the BOYZ award for best cabaret artist.

Transgender rights have come a long way in the last 20 years but there is still a high level of invisibility for us in the arts. I want to contribute to trans art by taking a new show to the Edinburgh Fringe Festival in 2014 and show the UK what we transfolk can do! 

My show will be called 'A Tranny on the Verge of a Nervous Breakdown!' But I can't do this without your help. If you support me I will be able to list my show on the local Fringe news and complete a full run (which I will be able to put on for free). I don't want to do a token show - I want it to be up there with the more established types of act.

What do I need and what can I give you in return?

I have saved up some money myself but don't have enough to take my show to the Fringe in order to give 26 free shows. I need another £3,000 to do it. This will pay for:

* My listings at the Fringe so people know I will be there

* Accommodation for the fortnight (a bedsit will do!)

* Travel (I'll stand on the baggage rack if I have to....)

* Administrative expenses - securing the show, etc

* Show expenses and props - and remember - I wont be charging an entry fee!

Supporting me is not just about shining a light on transgender art and allowing me to go to Edinburgh! As well as my gratitude and love you will receive one of 5 perks depending on your contribution. VIP access, private dinner at 116 Pall Mall or a special mention on my next video - there is a treat for everyone.

I have worked the budget out so that if I don't make my target of £3,000 I can do a limited run instead - perhaps not the full package but I won't let any contributions go to waste - I will do what I can within any means possible but the £3,000 is a realistic amount for the Fringe on a shoestring.

Impact

Each year I go to, and usually perform at, London's Trans Day of Remembrance. I do this to raise awareness of the plight of many trans people around the world. Last year the figure of trans murders were around 300 and that's the tip of the iceberg. 

This is important but this campaign is different, I want to show the talents of our community by taking my show to Edinburgh and representing the trans communities across the UK. I will be showing the positive side of trans and hopefully do my bit to raise the profile of trans causes. As a result of the publicity I hope to get I will raise awareness of trans issues in the UK and abroad. 

Other ways you can help

I hope you will be able to make a contribution but if not I still need your help. Please shout about my campaign and let me know about this crowdfunding project. 

Please share www.mzzkim.com.

Why not put on a benefit for me or do a sponsored run?

Or come a long to one of my fundraisers in London over the coming months (Check back here regularly for more details or on my www.facebook.com/mzz.kimberley).

But most importantly, I want to thank you for your support - whether in person or spirit - let's go to the Fringe together!

Lots of Love

Mzz Kimberley

Please shout about my campaign and let me know about this crowdfunding project. Please share www.mzzkim.com.Why not put on a benefit for me or do a sponsored run?Or come a long to one of my fundraisers in London over the coming months (Check back here regularly for more details or on my www.facebook.com/mzz.kimberley).But most importantly, I want to thank you for your support - whether in person or spirit - let's go to the Fringe together!Lots of LoveMzz Kimberley

story:
About The Project

Thank you for visiting our page! We are Astara Cambata, Beau Elsmore, and Dan Luck, and together we make up Pale Criminal Productions.

Our goal is to fund an original play devised by our company and to perform it in a number of venues and festivals across the U.K.

The Hive, written by Astara Cambata and directed by Beau Elsmore, is a naturalistic science fiction drama about individuality, love, and humanity in the age of technology. Your help would allow us to complete our vision in time for when you (hopefully) come and watch.

We are all graduating from Bath Spa University this summer and are producing this play in tandem with dissertations and other projects, so we really need your help in order to reach our fundraising goal!

If you'd like to know a bit more about the concept of hive mind, please give the unforgivably charming video above a watch.

Any help at all means so much to us, and more than anything we appreciate knowing that there are some like-minded nerds out there who also love theatre and science. This project has brought us together and we are excited to add as many Hive members to the fold as possible!

The Budget Breakdown

We've done our best to put together a quality performance on a student budget. We've bought a few of the items, such as the projector and costumes, in good faith that The Hive will be funded by thespian appreciation.

Costumes: 150
Props: 100
Set: 150
Technical Equipment: 150
Technician Hire: 150
Transportation: 400
Feeding the Actors: 100
Marketing: 150
Fringe Fees: 75


Total: 1425

If we reach our funding goal, then idiegogo has the rights to 4% of our funding. If we don't reach our goal, then indiegogo will claim 9% of our funding! Please help us to reach our goal and perform The Hive in as many venues across the UK as possible.

The Perks

£10 Postcard, Thank you card
£20 Digital Script, Postcard, Thank you card
£30 Script, Poster, Postcard, Thank you card
£50 Photobook, Digital Script, Postcard, Thank you card
£100 Information Cube, Photobook, Digital Script, Postcard, Thank you card

Now that you’ve got an idea of what your hard-earned cash will be spent on if you were to fund our project, we want to let you know what we plan on giving back. No matter how much you decide to donate, anything is immensely appreciated and we’d love all of you unconditionally forever.

“BUT ENOUGH ABOUT THAT,” your inner voice is screaming, “WHAT DO I GET IN RETURN FOR THIS? GIVE ME THINGS!”

Well, don’t you worry. We’ve got some lovely little incentives for you to get your soft, wee hands on if you feel so generous as to donate to our cause. There’s even an option to just donate without receiving any goodies in return at all if you’re feeling like a particularly good samaritan, but for those of you who are aching to get your mitts on the soon to be WORTH MILLIONS* memorabilia, listen up.

£10 PERK: For 10 of your shiny British pounds, you’ll get yourself a professionally-printed postcard featuring art by Pale Criminal, and a thank you card from all of us here at Pale Criminal Productions. Yes, even you!

£20 PERK: For £20, you’ll also receive a digital copy of The Hive’s script. Yes, you read that correctly. DIGITAL. If you properly back that thing up, that sucka will LAST FOREVER. Let’s be honest, it’s not as if computers and such will be going away anywhere any time soon. Want to read the script at your leisure? Want your great-great-great-great grandkids to read it, as pristine as when you first received it? Then look no further. This is the perk for you. And of course, you’ll get the previous perks as well.

£30 PERK *EXCLUSIVE PERK*: “But hold on one damn minute,” the more retro amongst you may well be thinking. “It’s all well and good having a digital version of the script, but nothing, NOTHING, compares to the feel of a fresh bit of reading material in your hands, opening it up for the first time and experiencing that first rush of ‘new page smell’. Well don’t you worry, traditionalists. For just £30, you’ll get a physical copy of the script for The Hive, AS WELL AS all the above perks. Want to embrace the digital age and yet remain firmly seated in human-reading-material-method history? This is the perk for you. It should be noted however, that ONLY BY SELECTING THIS PERK will you receive the physical script; not even if you select one of the upper tiered perks. Sorry about that, shipping costs and all that, you see. But it’s right here for the paper-ly inclined. So for physical script cravers, click the £30 tier!

£50 PERK: So you’ve got the cards. You’ve got the script. But something’s missing, isn’t it? You’ve got a veritable bounty of words in your generous hands and yet, there’s a crucial element missing. And quite obviously that element is IMAGES. PHOTOS. DYNAMIC VISUAL STIMULATION. And with a donation of £50, you’ll receive a photobook choc-full of glossy, professional promotional photos of The Hive, as well as all the previous perks, minus the physical script. Lovely how things turn out sometimes, isn’t it?

£100 PERK: We’re at dizzying heights now. If your golden heart decides to donate a veritable nest egg of £100 towards our humble project, then you’ll get a bona fide piece of Hive memorabilia from the show itself. For £100, you’ll receive an Information Cube such as those interacted with by characters in the play, bundled in (of course) with all of the previous perks listed above (again, minus the physical script. Additionally, you’ll receive our undying gratitude and love for all of eternity. Yes, these will be included in the package we send you; yes, they will be invisible. But you’ll FEEL them. You’ll feel them the instant you open your package of goodies. And they’ll be with you forever.

As mentioned before, no matter what you decide you to donate, each and every one is appreciated and loved equally and every last one will be put towards making this project as great as we believe it can be. So thank you for checking us out! We’ll do our best to make you all proud.

*dependent on future company member careers/infamous shooting sprees

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a donation right now there are still a few ways that you can really help us out. Please visit our facebook page and give us a like, watch our lovable youtube video, or share this fundraiser account on social media!

Thanks Hive members.
Sincerely,
Pale Criminal Productions + cast and crew

The Hive

Premiering at Bath Spa University

University Theatre May 7th 7pm

Playing at Bath Fringe Festival

Old Theatre Royal May 29th and 30th at 6pm


The funding for this project ends on May 28th. If The Hive is fully funded by this date then we would be able to continue showing the play at the Bierkeller and Cube theatres in Bristol as well as venues in London at the end of summer.

story:
Dear Supporter,

 Gift of Grace is an expanding and edifying dance company that began in my heart many years ago. Over the past couple of years, we have been blessed to perform in several venues, including productions held in the heart of Times Square. The spark these dancers leave on stage has earned them a spot in this dance company. My passion is to cultivate them and challenge them to greater heights.

 Unfortunately, because of low funding, very talented and hungry artists are unable to realize their dreams with Gift of Grace dance company. This is why we need your help. Your donation can secure the spot of our dancers’ position within the company’s upcoming productions.

All cash or check donations are accepted before March 26th. Please make any checks out to Argelis Capellan. No contribution is too small.

 We are so happy to hear of all the hearts that are touched through our movement and dance. We thank you for your financial pledge. We believe that dance can make a difference, so much in the performer as in the audience perceiving it. Thank for believing with us. We are young visionaries trying to leave a mark in this world through dance.

Dancing like no one is watching; Dancing to transmit a change in the atmosphere.

We thank you for your support.

Argelis Capellan

Dancers: Jaidah Downing, Talyah Browne, Nia Scott, Dejoy Rosso, Genesis Nivar, Marlene Perez, Mayi Perez, Raquel Sabino, John Rosario, Daruin Tavares, Janeyri Mendez
